defs: one who claps; a clapper.
to strike the palms of the hands together, as in applauding; to clap.
a small, hand-held banner or flag.
the palms of the hands joined together, as in respectful salutation or greeting.
the hollowed palm (as to hold something).
to stretch one's hand to hold another's as a help or in welcoming with a greeting, etc.
to help; to extend one's assistance to another.
(fig.) to cheat; to deceive.
skill in using one's hands; manual dexterity or adroitness.
power to produce effects or intended results; effectiveness of a doctor of medicine in curing diseases.
a thing done often and hence repeated without intention to do so; a habit.
to strike (heavily) with the fist.
(coll.) to start taking (one's) meal; to commence eating.
a cudgel held in the hand.
a small, flat-bladed, long-handled tool used for digging by pressing the metal blade into the ground with the foot; a hand-spade.
a thrusting blow with the fist; a punch.
a person's name written by that person, in a characteristic or individualistic style.
a small peg used by weavers while weaving.
a small stick, staff or post.
the state of being associated; companionship; fellowship; association.
the act and practice of deceiving; deception.
the act or fact of accomplishing; something accomplished or done successfully; work completed; achievement; an accomplishment.
to cause to hold each otheṛs hands; to cause to marry.
to do; to succeed in doing; to complete; to accomplish.
to cause to happen; to help accomplish (something).
to gather, muster (different persons, things, etc.) together.
to be accomplished; to be completed or achieved.
to happen; to occur.
to help; to assist; to give aid to.
to become assembled; to come together.
manual or unskilled labour done for (usu. little) pay paid on daily basis.
a payment received for such labour.
a child during the earliest period of life after birth; a child which can be or must be, carried in hands.
(fig.) a person whose actions, ideas, etc. are controlled by another.
(fig.) he who is entirely and helplessly depending on another without using his discretion.
(one's physical strength) to be lost or become weak.
the joint of finger bones.
to seize another's hand as to bring under one's control.
work done by oneself.
work done or made by hand, not by machine.
a petty work or service.
an article made by hand or manual skills (not using machine); a handicraft.
a stealing of or the habit of stealing, small sums or petty objects; pilferage.
a sword held in the hand.
to make beautiful or more beautiful; to put decorations on; to beautify.
to become beautiful; to adorn oneself (with dresses ornaments, etc.).
to be or become ready; to make oneself ready or prepared.
to make ready; to prepare.
work done by oneself.
the work of decorating, adorning, beautifying, etc.
a very short distance (as can be reached by stretching one's hand).
a rejoicing by clapping.
a figure of a human, animal, etc., made to move for entertainment; a small puppet.
(fig.) person, usu. one in a prominent position, whose actions appear to be his or her own, but are actually controlled by another; a puppet; a caṭs paw.
ಕೈಗೊಂಬೆಯಾಗಿಸಿಕೊ kaigombeyāgisiko to have a person under one's control; to have someone on a string.
a small tool for pounding, usu. consisting of a metal or wooden head fastened across one end of a handle.
a small tool for chopping trees and splitting wood with a long wooden handle and a metal head with a blade usu. on only one side; a hand-axe.
to shake one's hand as to cause something in hand be thrown down or to get rid of dust.
to evade doing (something that should be done); to shirk.
to stretch one's hand to hold another's as a help or in welcoming with a greeting, etc.
to help; to extend one's assistance to another.
(fig.) to cheat; to deceive.
a covering for the hand, made of leather, cloth, etc., with a separate cover for each finger and the thumb, used to keep the hand warm; a glove.
a shape formed by joining the palms with fingers of one hand inserted between the fingers of the other, as from cold.
